info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 18 at 2:50PM EDT until April 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches. * WHERE...The southern Adirondacks and the western Mohawk Valley of southern Herkimer County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 2 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The heavy wet snow may bring down some tree limbs and cause some power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will overspread the area this evening, then change to snow overnight. Snowfall rates may reach an inch per hour tonight through Tuesday morning. Snowfall will vary by elevation, with the lowest amounts near 5 inches in the western Mohawk Valley and highest amounts up to a foot in the Adirondacks above 2000 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
